page.title: 19LODGE FARM.
page.content: This farm is held together with New Barn Farm by{Mr.A.Purchase}as a tenant of the{National Trust, Kingston Lacy {Estates.}It has been in his family for 36 years and prior was held by the Kent family and before them the Bartletts. The farm is of 270 acres and is{arable,}60 acres of virgin downland being ploughed in 1949. Crops grown are wheat for bread flour, barley for animal feed and malting, rye for crispbreads. All straw is sold, no stubble burning.{Machinery {includes,}2 combines, tractors, drills, sprayer and 2 rotary muck spreaders. There are no farm residents but 5 employees work both holdings. Buildings include,{the Lodge}(see p.20), and an interesting range of old barns now N.T. property.{The Roman {road}from Badbury to Hamworthy runs through the farm.
